description: Derived from Latin vōciferārī (“shout, yell”), from vox (“voice”) + ferre (“to carry”) (see infer)  +‎ -ous. By surface analysis, voice +‎ -i- +‎ -ferous.

adjectives.description: vociferous (comparative more vociferous, superlative most vociferous)

entries.meaning: Making or characterized by a noisy outcry; clamorous.
examples: They crowded around him with vociferous welcome, Brown leading in a series of wild cheers.
Not even the most vociferous advocates of reform were willing to go to such lengths.
